In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah; We have a strong city; salvation will <FI>God<Fi> appoint <FI>for<Fi> walls and bulwarks.

For he bringeth down them that dwell on high; the lofty city, he layeth it low; he layeth it low, <FI>even<Fi> to the ground; he bringeth it <FI>even<Fi> to the dust.
The foot shall tread it down, <FI>even<Fi> the feet of the poor, <FI>and<Fi> the steps of the needy.
The way of the just <FI>is<Fi> uprightness: thou, most upright, dost weigh the path of the just.
Yea, in the way of thy judgments, O LORD, have we waited for thee; the desire of <FI>our<Fi> soul <FI>is<Fi> to thy name, and to the remembrance of thee.

With my soul have I desired thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek thee early: for when thy judgments <FI>are<Fi> in the earth, the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.
Let favour be shewed to the wicked, <FI>yet<Fi> will he not learn righteousness: in the land of uprightness will he deal unjustly, and will not behold the majesty of the LORD.

LORD, <FI>when<Fi> thy hand is lifted up, they will not see: <FI>but<Fi> they shall see, and be ashamed for <FI>their<Fi> envy at the people; yea, the fire of thine enemies shall devour them.<RF>at…: or, toward thy people<Rf><CM>
LORD, thou wilt ordain peace for us: for thou also hast wrought all our works in us.<RF>in us: or, for us<Rf>
O LORD our God, <FI>other<Fi> lords beside thee have had dominion over us: <FI>but<Fi> by thee only will we make mention of thy name.
<FI>They are<Fi> dead, they shall not live; <FI>they are<Fi> deceased, they shall not rise: therefore hast thou visited and destroyed them, and made all their memory to perish.
Thou hast increased the nation, O LORD, thou hast increased the nation: thou art glorified: thou hadst removed <FI>it<Fi> far <FI>unto<Fi> all the ends of the earth.
LORD, in trouble have they visited thee, they poured out a prayer <FI>when<Fi> thy chastening <FI>was<Fi> upon them.<RF>prayer: Heb. secret speech<Rf>
Like as a woman with child, <FI>that<Fi> draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain, <FI>and<Fi> crieth out in her pangs; so have we been in thy sight, O LORD.
We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.

Thy dead <FI>men<Fi> shall live, <FI>together with<Fi> my dead body shall they arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in dust: for thy dew <FI>is as<Fi> the dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast out the dead.<CM>
Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee: hide thyself as it were for a little moment, until the indignation be overpast.

For, behold, the LORD cometh out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.<RF>blood: Heb. bloods<Rf><CM>
